cyclone.name: DORIAN
cyclone.current_location: about 70 miles SSE of Charleston, South Carolina
cyclone.trajectory: tracking north-northeast along the Carolina coast, then turning northeast off the Mid-Atlantic coast toward Nova Scotia
cyclone.expected_landfall_location: near or over the North Carolina Outer Banks (Cape Hatteras area)

weather_observation.watch_coast: North of Chincoteague VA to Fenwick Island DE; Chesapeake Bay from Smith Point to Drum Point; Tidal Potomac south of Cobb Island; Woods Hole MA to Sagamore Beach MA including Nantucket and Martha's Vineyard
weather_observation.warning_coast: Savannah River SC to NC/VA border (Hurricane Warning); NC/VA border to Chincoteague VA and Chesapeake Bay south of Smith Point (Tropical Storm Warning)
weather_observation.impacted_coast: Southeastern US through the Mid-Atlantic and New England coasts
weather_observation.wind: Gusty winds possibly reaching 30–40 mph Friday, but overall chance of sustained tropical-storm-force winds is low (~6%).
weather_observation.storm_surge: None expected at South Jersey Port Corp, NJ.
weather_observation.rainfall: Outer rainbands could bring around 1–2 inches of rain Friday into early Saturday.
weather_observation.other_hazards: Dangerous surf and rip currents along the New Jersey shoreline may disrupt vessel approaches and small-craft operations.
